article.title: BAE Awarded Electronic Warfare Contract
article.text:
BAE Systems Information and Electronic Systems Integration, Greenlawn, New York, has been awarded an estimated $248,200,000 requirements contract for various electronic warfare, automatic test and support equipment systems including but not limited to F-16, C-130, B-1B ATE, APX 113, ALQ-161 and ALM -288. The contractor will provide sustainment of spares/buys, repairs and engineering services related to various systems and components that are sole source to BAE. Work will be performed at primary locations San Diego; Austin, Texas; Greenlawn, New York; and Nashua, New Hampshire. It is expected to be completed by June 30, 2021. This award is the result of a sole-source acquisition. No funds are being obligated at the time of award. Air Force Sustainment Center, Robins Air Force Base, Georgia, is the contracting activity (FA8522-15-D-0012).
